Label.text: Titanbreaker is a 5 player dungeon. It can be played with less players but it will be hard. Each player will be revived 5 times after dying, after that they have to start a new game or they stay and observe the remaining heroes who are still alive.
Currently the maximum hero level is 100. When you level up, you gain 13 Ability Points, plus 1 at Level 40, 60, 80 and 100.
All creatures have an aggro system, causing them to attack whoever damages them the most. It is advised to pick atleast 1 Tank and 1 Healer to survive longer.

Item drop rules: For each player an individual roll is performed to check if an item drops, whenever a creature is killed. Bosses and Champions drop an item with a 100% chance, while killing a complete trash mob camp roughly has a total 2% chance to drop an item. Item quality when killing a Boss is as follows: Legendary 0.1%, Epic 1%, Rare 10%, Common 25%, rolled in that order, if none of these dropped, a white item will drop.

The first Act has the difficulty you select at the start of the game. Each following Act is 10% more difficult compared to the initial difficulty setting. For example, if you select Monster Level 2, the Act difficulties will be 200% for the first Act, 220% for the 2nd Act, 240% for the third Act and so on. Item drop quality increases faster than difficulty does, as an incentive to play on challening Monster Levels, the formula is: LootQuality = ( ZoneDifficulty * 1.25 ) - 0.25. For example a Zone with Monster Level 2 would lead to LootQuality = 2 * 1.25 - 0.25 = 2.25 = 225% loot quality. This LootQuality factor is multiplied on top of the drop chance, so it would for example increase the Epic drop chance on bosses from 1% to 1% * 225% = 2.25%. Experience scales exponetially.

Summons from Abilities and Companions from Items, like the ones from the Dragon Set series, deal Damage whenever they attack. However, the damage dealt acts as if it were Damage done by an Ability of its master, meaning it will cause aggro and can for example benefit from Ability Critical Strikes on items worn by the master.
Items that state to be purchasable at the Side Shop can be purchased at the Molten Forge. Items that state to be purchasable at the Secret Shop can not be purchased.

When you try to buy an Item and it says YOUR HERO CAN NOT USE THAT ITEM, just save and start a fresh game. It occurs when too many Items dropped in your current game, disabling buying more Items from the shop. It is a DotA inherent mechanic, protecting against mass item buying.
